reviews.sentence: Nice people but could have been cleaner. Stayed overnight for a conference being held in the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. When I got to my floor at 7 pm there was still several laundry piles all over the halls around my floor. Even after the laundry was finally picked up no matter where I stood on my floor I could see several pieces of trash that had been left behind this continued until morning when I checked out. I would not make a special effort to go back there but it was not a terrible stay.
Nice clean room and friendly staff.

Perfect for late night check in. Checked in late at night. Staff was very helpful. Chinese food delivery recommended by desk clerk was excellent. Great tip. Was tired and hungry from long flight. Perfect for the weary traveler.
Meeting space is nice and hotel staff are great at hosting large gatherings.

Nice. Much better than I had expected. I would not write this review if the previous ones had not. This hotel is ok for the price. If someone think it is too difficult to drive hie. her car onto the free car park it is their problem not the hotels. The room is ok and the service ok. No problem to understand the front desk people as someone before me had. Again this is not the hotels problem. As in most all American hotels they have these bacteria filled carpets in the rooms unfortunately. But progress and development will reach US too I hope.

Excellent. Room was great not vary many food places around the hotel so we ended up eating there food was pretty good and the service was great. Location nothing much around the hotel as in food or shopping.
Exceptional. great location to DAL airport.
Location feeling of being safe. Bathroom was not clean. Shower had build up with red stuff on shower head hair still in tub lip smudge on glass and mirror dirty.

Close to everything with best breakfast. I always try to book this hotel when traveling to DalasThe breakfast is the very best though expensive especially if you are a New YorkerBagels Nova Scotia salmon capers blintzes just a few of the many itemsTwo kinds of scrambled egsVery friendly personal and a bottle of water upon arrival to add just a few of the pluses I highly recommend this place.
Exceptional. The staff was very and helpful I missed breakfast but there was a jack n the box within walking distance.
Hotel smelled including the room. Needs a remodel. Customer service was excellent.

Disappointing older and tatty property. I was diverted to Dallas due to Hurricane Harvey. At 2 AM I booked this hotel via Priceline Express Deal non refundable rate of 73 night since I was counting on the upscale 35star rating. Front desk. Arriving at 230 AM I could n’t expect too much from the night auditor but he was a bit flummoxed at finding my reservation. Eventually he did and issued me a key to Room 70Rom. Opening the room I heard the A C running. Being from Texas this is one of the mandatory things to be working. The panel read “ 64 degrees ” but being from here I knew that there was no way this was accurate. Given that it was almost 3 AM I decided I would report it in the morning since I would n’t burn up in the meantime. Needless to say this lack of maintenance would become a theme. The room is average with nothing distinctive but showing its age. The view from the window is over the freeway and nothing of note is within walking distance. Bathroom. Waking up 8 hours later I wanted to shower and get ready for a return to the airport to see if I could get reboked on my flight home. That is when I noticed that the sheetrock above the shower was blistered from a prior repair but never cosmetically fixed. I soldiered on by taking a shower and then discovered that the wall dryer unit did not work – despite pushing all of the circuit breaker reset buttons it never worked and I had to call the front desk to have someone bring me a handheld one. If you want to hold yourself out as an upscale property these large and small items does n’t help your reputation. Housekeeping Since my stay was an overnight one I can only comment on how I found the room. It was nicely cleaned so no complaints there. Upon checkout I reported all three issues to Juan at the front desk. He was genuinely interested noted them on a pad and apologized. He offered me a voucher for a free breakfast which was appreciated. Overall this property suffers from over promising and under delivering. Crowne Plazas should be the jewel brand of the IHG group but this one is an imposter. Management should seriously put some energy and money into fixing this – or forfeit the brand name. Its star rating is really more a 2star since some 25 star properties put this one to shame. Priceline asked if I wanted to rebok this property for another night – and my thought was. “ No way”NOTE If you found this review useful could you click on the “ thank you ” button below. It helps me tailor reviews to include things that are useful to fellow travelers. Thank you.
Roaches and homeless people.

Pictures tell a different story. I booked this hotel on Expedia. I looked at the photos before I booked. I traveled from IL. To Dallas once I arrived I was ready to rest. I arrived at the hotel. The staff was not friendly the hotel is very dated. Nothing like the pictures. It took from Friday til Monday before a manager got back with me about the experience.

If it was possible to give a negative star rating for this hotel I would. Absolutely the worst hotel experience ever. Nothing works including the heat. The beds are concave. We changed rooms 3 times and finally just gave up. I ordered a glass of wine at the very disorganized and understaffed bar and grill and it literally took an hour. do not stay at this hotel.

Great Dallas views and convenient to Love airport. The indoor pool was the best thing going. Overall hotel was not worth the price we paid. Beds were extremely small and funneled us to the middle. Everything was run down and could use an update. Frayed carpet older furniture iffy elevators even the exterior sign advertised the Crow as the other lights were burnt out. Staff was friendly enough quickly brought extra linens when requested. This was our first and likely only time staying at a Plaza hotel because of this stay.

Good and bad but mostly bad. Then they gave me keys to someone elses room. Walk in on 2 very nice gentleman. Thank goodness they were dressed. Then the front desk lady blamed them for not having the security lock on. She was throwing the blame all over except at herself. Pool was nasty. Looked like some sort of film over it. It was room temperature not what I would call heated. Signs for a whirlpool and spa but never found it. Looks like it was taken out for more tables. Rooms were ok. Found some trash under the dresser and the minifridge did not work. Last day we were there all of the keys stopped working. Not just ours but everyones. We parked in the back so had to cut through the laundry to get into the hotel. Stayed at a ton of Crowne Plaza hotels across Texas. This one needs some serious training and attention. Beware of the 100 deposit. Not just a credit card left for incidentals. They will run it and then you wait 2 weeks to get it back.

2 star hotel. Undergoing constriction at 7 am daily. Also room service lacked severely. waited til 4 pm for it. Staff friendly but who cares about friendly when you need SERVICE. CARPET DISGUSTING CEILING PEILING FULL SIZE BEDS NOT QUEEN NO FREE BREAKFAST MINUTES FROM DOWNTOWN BUT NOT WALKABLE. OVERALL 2 STAR.
I always enjoy my stay at this hotel. I am giving it 4 stars for a few reasons. The hotel smelled like smoke in the hallways at least on my floor. The hotel is currently being renovated.

Staying here while in town for work. The remodeled rooms are modern and very nice. The beds are brand new and you will get a great nights sleep. There is a nice restaurant and bar. The customer service here is by far the best that I have ever received. Everyone you speak to is terrific and personal. Quick room service and complimentary water bottles.

Staff is the only good thing going. This hotel is 20 minutes from DFW airport. We only needed a place to crash for the night and thank God it was only one night. The only thing this hotel has going for itself is the staff. If the staff had not been as friendly and accommodating as they were we would have jumped ship and requested a full refund. We booked a king room with a sofa bed. We entered a room with a king bed and lounge chair with ottoman. Went to the front desk and they were very apologetic and quick to give us another room. We do n’t blame them for this as it seems Bokingcom did n’t fully communicate the details of our booking. They graciously moved us to another king room with a sofa bed. At first glance the room seemed perfect. Nice layout nice size. seemingly clean. We put our daughter to bed and shortly after she fell asleep I went to check on her only to find myself standing in water and on soggy wet carpet. Which would explain the musty smell I was struggling with. Once again my husband found himself going down to explain the situation and once again we found ourselves packing up and moving again. This time to a two queen room. The room was fine and again seemingly clean. We slept on and off but the highway noise was disturbing. The hotel did compensate us with a free breakfast which was very good for a hotel breakfast but not for the price it would have been had we paid. The restaurant staff were wonderful. This hotel needs help it ’s run down outdated and falling apart. The pool chlorine level was way to high. It burned your nose upon entering. I feel sorry for the employees. It ’s as if they know this hotel is a mangy dog so they make the most of it with their upbeat attitudes and hope their smile goes a mile.

Not their fault but they had a lot of things go wrong during our stay. Pipes burst sewage credit card system went down all weekend. I feel bad for the staff having to deal with it. The reno looks nice but the stay was not without its challenges.
Very Poor. this place is awful I was by a mechanical room that buzzed all night and the elevators broke down on me also. a complete awful hotel stay.

40 Year High School Reunion. We gathered for a 40 year HS reunion negotiated a rate for a block of rooms while we were all making plans to stay we all found much lower prices on line than the price quoted to us. We jumped that hurdle and they reduced our room rates. Upon my check in the girl at the front desk was not friendly or welcoming. I kept having to ask her to repeat herself because she mumbled. No big deal but just off putting. While checking in she was the only person at the front desk she answered the phone and a long line formed behind me. Another employee came by and asked her some questions and then left and not there to help the long line checking in. The lobby was very warm it was a hot windy day but seemed like there a c was having problems. My room was a little warm. a c set on high fan and 60 it never really cooled off. Others in our group changed rooms in hopes the a c would work better it did not. As far as the event it went off without a hitch the young lady at the hotel that assisted us was fabulous she cared about how things were going. The gentleman in charge of the food and servers was on the spot with any and everything we needed. Overall a good experience but the hotel is a little tired and the area is not that great.

When I checked in and went to the room my keys did not work went back to desk I was on the 14th floor so it was a trip and got new keys. They did not work either. Went back to desk and got a new room. No working ice makers had to go back to lobby for ice and was offered a 3 pound bag of ice. ugh. This place is in dire need of maintenance.

Switched hotels within hours. We arrived checked in ok we were put on the 7th floor. Walked into our room it was a sauna in there thermostat set to 90 poor circulation. We adjusted the thermostat and that takes time to kick in. Our toilet was malfunctioning before we ever got to use it was not refilling properly and kept running. We called for maintenance and it took nearly 90 min for them to arrive. He let us know that all elevators in the hotel were now out of service including the service elevators. He had to use the steps from the 22nd floor to the ground floor to get the elevator key to get people out of the elevator that were stuck in it. We confirmed that all elevators were indeed out of service and another employee let us know that the service elevators had not been working for the past 3 months and 2 of the 4 guest elevators were ever in service at all. He even recommended we go to another hotel. Well we grabbed our things walked down 7 flights to the ground floor. I decided to use the lobby bathroom before leaving. The stall door I utilized the locking mechanism was swinging loose and holding on by 1 loose screw went to wash my hands neither towel dispenser had towels one of them was even open showing it was empty. No resistance from front desk when we told them we were leaving BUT when they ran our CC to hold for incidentals and the hotel was pre paid it was charged twice. that is currently in dispute Horrible experience just in the first few hours.

First and last stay at market center location. Location. I got stuck in the elevator my first night. Only one elevator worked out of four. One of the beds in my room was broke. The cleaning staff did n’t bother to clean my room during my stay. I had to chase them down to empty my trash and to get fresh towels.
Awful. Dirty. Broken elevators. Disgusting coffee makers. Rude staff. I would never reco end this place to anyone.

Frozen. The first night I was in the room there was no heat. I froze in night when I would try to adjust the thermostat it just got colder. I finally had to call the front desk. the best they could do was send me up an extra blanket.
